intro: Bidens ekmanii, commonly known as the narrowleaf tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with dark brown centers. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Bidens ekmanii is an annual plant that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its ability to spread across arid regions.
